intro: Galium serpylloides, commonly known as lesser bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruit is a small, dry capsule that contains several seeds. Galium serpylloides is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
